Description: Rim sherd of Attic red-figured pottery plastic vessel with short offset rim; interior glazed black; exterior: black ivy wreath at rim, above projecting part, which is now reserved, but was probably originally in barbotine; at right, volute from a floral design, likely to be near a handle.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The diameter seems too large for a rhyton with moulded decoration, on which an ivy band is not otherwise attested.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 501, no. C48)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0844) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 120, pl. LXVI, no. 5)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
